summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of Janusz Banasiak, a former property manager for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach from 2005 to 2017. Banasiak describes his duties, reporting structure to Ghislaine Maxwell, the presence of a 'black book' containing contact numbers for massage girls and famous individuals, and the daily occurrence of massage appointments at the residence.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.role: Former property manager/handyman for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI and AUSA in 2021. Worked for Epstein at his Palm Beach house from 2005 to 2017, responsible for property maintenance, preparing for Epstein's visits, and answering phones.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as Banasiak's employer. Banasiak describes his preferences (exotic flowers), daily massage appointments at his Palm Beach house, and the presence of contact books containing numbers for 'massage girls' and famous people.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Banasiak reported to her for the first 2-3 years of his employment. She organized Epstein's schedule, set household rules, instructed Banasiak on phone protocol and flower preferences, and was initially present when massage girls arrived.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the famous people whose contact information was contained in a black address book kept in Epstein's house.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the famous people whose contact information was contained in a black address book kept in Epstein's house.

connections.description: Banasiak was employed by Epstein as a property manager/handyman at his Palm Beach residence from 2005 to 2017.
Banasiak reported directly to Maxwell for his first 2-3 years working for Epstein. She gave him instructions and set household rules.
Maxwell is described as being involved in everything, organizing Epstein's schedule, and making household decisions. She was his assistant and reported to him.
Clinton's name and contact information were listed in a black address book kept in Epstein's house, indicating a social or professional connection.
Trump's name and contact information were listed in a black address book kept in Epstein's house, indicating a social or professional connection.

events.title: Banasiak begins employment with Epstein
events.description: Janusz Banasiak started working for Jeffrey Epstein as a property manager at his Palm Beach house.

events.title: Banasiak ends employment with Epstein
events.description: Banasiak stopped working for Epstein, describing it as a mutual separation after he found another job.

events.title: FBI interview of Janusz Banasiak
events.description: Banasiak was interviewed via WebEx by an AUSA and a detective regarding his time working for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Daily massage appointments at Epstein's Palm Beach house
events.description: Banasiak states that during Epstein's stays, young women came to the house 'almost every day' for massages. Appointments were scheduled by Epstein's assistants.

locations: Palm Beach house (Epstein's residence in Palm Beach, Florida)
New York City (location where Banasiak was sometimes taken to work)
Mar-a-Lago (where Ghislaine Maxwell would play tennis and go to dinner)
keyFacts: Janusz Banasiak worked as a property manager for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach from approximately 2005 to 2017.
Banasiak confirmed the existence of 'black books' in Epstein's houses containing contact numbers for massage girls and famous people, including Bill Clinton and Donald Trump.
Massage appointments with young women occurred at the Palm Beach house 'almost every day' during Epstein's stays.
Banasiak reported to Ghislaine Maxwell initially, who set household rules and was involved in scheduling.
At an unspecified time, a man came to the Palm Beach house and removed 3-4 desktop computers at the direction of an assistant named 'Sarah.'
